title: Trump Gives Mexico a Reprieve but Slams Canada With Higher Tariffs
summary: The imbalance in President Trump’s treatment of America’s closest trading partners may come from his desire to make Canada the 51st state, some Canadians believe.

title: The New Tariff Twist, and a $250 Million A.I. Job Offer
summary: Plus, your Friday news quiz.

title: Arab States Call for Hamas to Disarm Amid Push for a Palestinian State
summary: “Hamas must end its rule in Gaza,” reads a declaration endorsed by the 22 member nations of the Arab League.

title: Trump Envoy Witkoff Is Set to Visit Gaza as Aid Crisis Deepens
summary: Steve Witkoff visited the enclave on Friday amid growing pressure on Israel to ease the hunger crisis. Hamas said the trip would be a “propaganda show.”

title: Trump, Term-Limited, Amasses $200 Million War Chest for Political Ambitions
summary: The money is meant to beat Democrats, but some Republicans worry it could be used to beat Republicans, too.

title: Corruption Scandal Puts Mexico’s President on Defense Against Trump
summary: Mexico’s president, battling U.S. accusations that the cartels have gripped her government, is facing a scandal in which two former officials are on the run and their old boss is now a top senator.

title: Trump Sharpens Sanctions Threat on Russia, While Admitting It May Not Work
summary: “We’re going to put sanctions,” the president said, even before a deadline he had given Russia this week to engage in cease-fire negotiations had passed.

title: Fleeing Domestic Violence, and the Russian Advance
summary: “I wanted something decent,” said a woman at a shelter near Ukraine’s border with Russia. “But this is how it turned out.”

title: A Former Rolling Stone Says the Met Has His Lost Guitar. The Museum Says No Way.
summary: Representatives for Mick Taylor, the Rolling Stones’ former guitarist, said the Les Paul was stolen from him decades ago. The museum says he never owned it and has not made a claim.

title: In Delhi and New York, Hindu Right Wing Lines Up Against Mamdani
summary: As Zohran Mamdani gets within striking distance of becoming New York’s first Muslim mayor, he is drawing fire from supporters of India’s populist prime minister, who accuse him of being anti-Hindu.

title: Art Spiegelman, John Waters and Other Banned Artists on How Censorship Changed Them
summary: Nine artists on how American censorship changed their work and their lives.

title: A Funeral Shines a Light on the Bangladeshis Thriving in the N.Y.P.D.
summary: At least 1,000 of the department’s 34,000 officers belong to the Bangladeshi American Police Association. They are members of the latest immigrant group to join the force.

title: Manhattan Has More Secure Buildings Than Most Cities. That Wasn’t Enough.
summary: Decades of threats have heightened security in New York City. But Monday’s attack in a Park Avenue office building shows the limits of preparedness.

title: Virginia Education Board Could Oust George Mason’s President
summary: Republicans have attacked the president, Gregory Washington, over his support for diversity efforts at the university, Virginia’s largest public institution.

title: Trump Administration Cuts UCLA Funding Over Claims of Antisemitism, Chancellor Says
summary: The university is the latest to be targeted by the federal government over accusations that it has not done enough to fight antisemitism on campus.

title: Cécile Dionne, Who Found Fame and Despair as a Quintuplet, Dies at 91
summary: The Dionnes, the first quints known to have survived infancy, became a global sensation and prey for the greedy. And Cécile came to resent it all. Only one of the five now survives.

title: Feeding the Maine Lobster Roll Boom
summary: At one of the most renowned lobster shacks — and across the country — the star dish just keeps getting more popular.

title: A French Beach Town’s Plea to Tourists: Keep Your Clothes On
summary: “A little restraint, please!” wrote the mayor of Les Sables d’Olonne, who is leading an effort to stop visitors from wandering the town in just their swimwear.

title: So Long, ‘South Park’ Conservatives
summary: There’s no more pretending that it’s rebellious to be reactionary.

title: The Book That Explains JD Vance’s Worldview
summary: Yoram Hazony, the author of “The Virtue of Nationalism,” discusses the principles of national conservatism.

title: The Politics of Masks
summary: How masking is a source of both power and protection.

title: Kamala Harris’s Post-Election TV Diet: ‘Lots of Cooking Shows’
summary: The former vice president told Stephen Colbert that she didn’t watch the news for months after losing to Donald Trump. “I’m just not into self-mutilation,” she said.

title: El Salvador Changes Constitution, Ending Term Limits for Nayib Bukele
summary: The president, a Trump ally, will now be able to seek re-election indefinitely. The National Assembly also extended the presidential term to six years.

title: E.U. Did Not Retain Texts Sought by Journalists on Covid Vaccine Deal
summary: The European Union acknowledged for the first time that a top official reviewed the messages, but said it had no duty to keep them, despite intense interest.

title: Mary Gaillard, Who Broke a Ceiling in Subatomic Research, Dies at 86
summary: Overcoming discrimination in a mostly male preserve, she did groundbreaking work that showed experimentalist physicists where and how to look for new particles.

title: Kamala Harris Tells Colbert She Wants a Break From Public Office
summary: The former Democratic nominee for president explained why she did not run for California governor in her first interview since leaving office as vice president.
